class Bernoulli(ps=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.distribution.Distribution

Parameters:ps – probabilities (vector [0, 1])

Distribution over a vector of independent Bernoulli variables. Each element of the vector takes on a value in {0, 1}.

batch_log_pdf(x, ps=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

class Categorical(ps=None, vs=None, one_hot=True, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.distribution.Distribution

Parameters:
  • ps – probabilities (can be unnormalized) (vector or real array [0, Infinity))
  • vs – support (any numpy array, Variable, or list)
  • one_hot – if True, sample() returns a one_hot sample. True by default.

Discrete distribution over elements of vs with P(vs[i]) proportional to ps[i]. If one_hot=True, sample returns a one-hot vector. Else, sample returns the category selected.

batch_log_pdf(x, ps=None, vs=None, one_hot=True, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

support(ps=None, vs=None, one_hot=True, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
class Delta(v=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.distribution.Distribution

Parameters:v – support element (any)

Discrete distribution that assigns probability one to the single element in its support. Delta distribution parameterized by a random choice should not be used with MCMC based inference, as doing so produces incorrect results.

batch_log_pdf(x, v=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
log_pdf(x, v=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
sample(v=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
support(v=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
class DiagNormal(mu=None, sigma=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.distribution.Distribution

Parameters:
  • mu – mean (tensor)
  • sigma – standard deviations (tensor (0, Infinity))

A distribution over tensors in which each element is independent and Gaussian distributed, with its own mean and standard deviation. i.e. A multivariate Gaussian distribution with diagonal covariance matrix. The distribution is over tensors that have the same shape as the parameters mu and sigma, which in turn must have the same shape as each other.

batch_log_pdf(x, mu=None, sigma=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Diagonal Normal log-likelihood

log_pdf(x, mu=None, sigma=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Diagonal Normal log-likelihood

sample(mu=None, sigma=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Reparameterized diagonal Normal sampler.

class LogNormal(mu=None, sigma=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.distribution.Distribution

Parameters:
  • mu – mean (vector)
  • sigma – standard deviations (vector (0, Infinity))

A distribution over probability vectors obtained by exp-transforming a random variable drawn from Normal({mu: mu, sigma: sigma}).

class Multinomial(ps=None, n=None, batch_size=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.distribution.Distribution

Parameters:
  • ps – probabilities (real array with elements that sum to one)
  • n – number of trials (int (>=1))

Distribution over counts for n independent Discrete({ps: ps}) trials.

class NormalChol(mu=None, L=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.distribution.Distribution

Parameters:
  • mu – mean (real)
  • sigma – standard deviation (real (0, Infinity))
  • L – Cholesky decomposition

A multi-variate normal distribution with arbitrary covariance sigma parameterized by its mean and its cholesky decomposition L. Parameters must have dimensions <= 2.

batch_log_pdf(x, batch_size=1)[source]¶
log_pdf(x, mu=None, L=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
